title: [LEAVERBUSTER] - Your shit is fucked up.
body:
Is LeaverBuster intended to punish people who have network problems?

I loaded in fine, then got to lane and right as the minions met, I got the "Attempting to disconnect". After a bunch of work, I finally was able to reconnect. To add insult to injury, I got hit with a LeaverBuster. I left due to network problems, then returned ASAP, and stayed for the entire loss. For my perseverance, I was rewarded with a 5x20 LPQ.

Step-by-step instructions:
1. Load into a game of League
2. Have your network connection status go to "connected", "Secured, no internet"
3. Close client, attempt to restart for 5 or 6 times.
4. Turn WiFi off and on several times
5. Reconnect
6. Finish the game.
7. Get rewarded for your effort with LeaverBuster

Before some wiseass comments about my getting a 20-minute LPQ, I've had network trouble very often.

replies.body: [Leaverbuster](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752714-LeaverBuster-FAQ) is intended to give players time to troubleshoot whatever is causing them to leave, or allow time in case an interruption would happen were there not a lower priority queue.  Even if it's something out of your control, they still cause a negative experience for other players so it's important to get that fixed up.  I recommend using our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to troubleshoot whatever is causing your network a failure to connect to the game server.  Good luck!
